All of the given phrases have synecdic words in them. The synecdic word is a word that describes the action of the verb rather than the subject. 
For example, in the first phrase "білими нитками шитий" (lit. "with white spots painted on them"), "білими" means "painted with white spots" rather than "with white spots."
